metadata.Title: CVE-2023-25733 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The return value from `gfx::SourceSurfaceSkia::Map()` wasn't being verified which could have potentially lead to a null pointer dereference. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 110.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-25733` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
